meanings.definition: Of or relating to a flag or banner.
meanings.sent1: The vexillary design on the flag was colorful and eye-catching.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers proudly carried the vexillary banner into battle.
meanings.sent3: The vexillary flag fluttered in the wind, making it easy to spot in the distance.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a vexillary beacon, guiding him through the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The vexillary symbol on the banner symbolized unity and strength.

meanings.definition: Serving as a standard-bearer or flag-bearer.
meanings.sent1: The vexillary soldier led the parade with the flag held high.
meanings.sent2: She was chosen as the vexillary representative for the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The cat fancied itself a vexillary leader, carrying a toy flag around the house.
meanings.sent4: His voice was a vexillary call, rallying the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The vexillary role required courage and honor to uphold the flag.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to military standards or banners.
meanings.sent1: The vexillary decorations on the military base added a touch of pride.
meanings.sent2: The general inspected the vexillary standards before the parade.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to view the acorn as a vexillary treasure to protect.
meanings.sent4: The music played was a vexillary anthem, stirring emotions in the soldiers.
meanings.sent5: The vexillary symbols on the banners represented different regiments in the army.
